title: Looking for a Brudi-like face
content:
Can anyone recommend a digital face that closely resembles Brudi's Pan or, better yet, the lettering he used in this stamp?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Brudi1\_web.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017223256/http:/typophile.com/files/Brudi1_web.jpg) | 56.33 KB |
| [KS182-medium.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017223256/http:/typophile.com/files/KS182-medium.jpg) | 58.48 KB |
author: inferno

comments.content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017223256im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Brudi1_web_5612.jpg)

Here's the stamp and lettering in question. And here's Pan:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017223256im_/http:/typophile.com/files/KS182-medium_5316.jpg)

The lettering on the stamp doesn't look like Pan to me. Which words do you see using it?

- Mike Yanega
Pan is shown in the type specimen, not the stamp.
